snippet: Twitter’s initial public offering, which values the company at roughly $18 billion, is a sign of its maturity, even as it combats slowing growth.
abstract: Twitter sets price of its initial public offering at $26 a share, valuing company at $18.1 billion; 70 million shares are sold in offering, raising $1.8 billion; firm combats slowing growth, as attracting and retaining users has become one of its biggest challenges.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Twitter’s initial public offering, which values the company at roughly $18 billion, is a sign of its maturity, even as it combats slowing growth.

headline.main: Twitter Prices Its Initial Offering at $26 Per Share
headline.print_headline:
Taking Flight at Last: Twitter
Saunters,
But I.P.O.
Soars
